result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gerzon Sosa

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Gerzon Sosa in court.  Attorney Brett Lee Copeland appeared by video for Gerzon Sosa.  Attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for State of Wisconsin. 

SPANISH INTERPRETER SWORN: Fred Svensson

Case set for preliminary hearing. Preliminary hearing proceeded. Sworn for the State: MPD Police Officer N. Swenson. State rests. Defense rests. Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Original information received and filed; defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Case is adjourned to Branch 28. Scheduling conference scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Supervision Report dated October 31, 2022 - received

Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. Sworn as interpreter: Reme Bashi.
Case set for a preliminary hearing 10/11/2022. States witness is present. Due to the lateness of the hour this matter was unable to be called.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Supervision Report dated October 10, 2022 - received
Sworn as Spanish interpreter: Kelley Salas

Defendant Gerzon Sosa in court in person.  Attorney Brett Lee Copeland appeared by video for Gerzon Sosa.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness is not present but subpoena was sent out. Case is adjourned. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Supervision Report dated September 19, 2022 - received

Defendant Gerzon Sosa in court, appeared in person.  Attorney Brett Lee Copeland appeared by video for Gerzon Sosa. Abby Rockendorf in court, appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Sworn as Spanish interpreter: Natalia Fajardo.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Attorney Copeland need more time to meet with client with a Spanish speaking interpreter. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Supervision Report dated August 24, 2022 - received

Defendant Gerzon Sosa in court in person.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter: Brenda Bartholomew. 
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State requests the matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing or status; denied.  Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Supervision Report dated July 13, 2022 - received

Court ordered no contact with BRG-G,; NM-R,; NH,; Milwaukee Central Hispanic Church
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Gerzon Sosa in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Defendant Gerzon Sosa in custody.  Nate K. McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Gerzon Sosa appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
